result.markdown:
--- title: "Randomized Controlled Trials" --- > ### **`Assignment 8:`** Given a set of Data about a randomized experiment run by an online shop. E-commerce websites frequently conduct numerous randomized experiments, commonly referred to as AB testing in a business context. 1. Check whether the covariates are balanced across the groups. Use a plot to show it. 2. Run a regression to find the effect of chatbot on sales. 3. Find subgroup-specific effects by including an interaction. Compute a CATE for one exemplary group. 4. Use the outcome variable purchase and run a logistic regression and interpret the coefficient for chatbot. ### **Solution:** 1. Differences Plots: to check the balance of the covariates, their differences are plotted for both groups (with/ without chatbot). ::: {.cell hash='06_rct_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_6421b619c254465d8841b17e8ac95974'} ```{.r .cell-code} #Load Library & data: library(tidyverse) abtest_online <- readRDS("D:/OneDrive/Samantha/TUHH/1stsemester/Causal Data Science for Business Analytics (SE)/Causal_Data_Science_Data/abtest_online.rds") head(abtest_online) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Previous Visits difference plot: compare_previsit <- ggplot(abtest_online, aes(x = chatbot, y = previous_visit, color = as.factor(chatbot))) + stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", width = .5, fun.data = "mean_se", fun.args = list(mult=1.96), show.legend = F) + labs(x = NULL, y = "Previous Visit", title = "Difference in previous visits") compare_previsit ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06_rct_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Mobile Device users difference plot: compare_mobiledevice <- ggplot(abtest_online, aes(x = chatbot, y = mobile_device, color = as.factor(chatbot))) + stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", width = .5, fun.data = "mean_se", fun.args = list(mult=1.96), show.legend = F) + labs(x = NULL, y = "Mobile Device", title = "Difference in mobile users") compare_mobiledevice ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06_rct_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Purchase difference plot: compare_purchase <- ggplot(abtest_online, aes(x = chatbot, y = purchase, color = as.factor(chatbot))) + stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", width = .5, fun.data = "mean_se", fun.args = list(mult=1.96), show.legend = F) + labs(x = NULL, y = "Purchase", title = "Difference in purchases") compare_purchase ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06_rct_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-3.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Purchases amount difference plot: compare_purchaseamount <- ggplot(abtest_online, aes(x = chatbot, y = purchase_amount, color = as.factor(chatbot))) + stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", width = .5, fun.data = "mean_se", fun.args = list(mult=1.96), show.legend = F) + labs(x = NULL, y = "Purchase Amount", title = "Difference in purchases amount") compare_purchaseamount ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06_rct_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-4.png){width=672} ::: ::: As illustrated by the plots the covariates are not balanced. 2. The effect of chatbot on sales: ::: {.cell hash='06_rct_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_a3be9ecf794576d91d4bc532dd593705'} ```{.r .cell-code} #Linear Regression on Chatbot: lm_chatbot <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot, data=abtest_online) summary(lm_chatbot) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot, data = abtest_online) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -16.702 -14.478 -9.626 13.922 64.648 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 16.7017 0.8374 19.944 < 2e-16 *** #> chatbotTRUE -7.0756 1.1796 -5.998 2.79e-09 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 18.65 on 998 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.0348, Adjusted R-squared: 0.03383 #> F-statistic: 35.98 on 1 and 998 DF, p-value: 2.787e-09 ``` ::: ::: By checking the estimate value, having a chatbot has a negative relation with the purchases amount (sales). 3. Mobile users sub-group effect: ::: {.cell hash='06_rct_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_b74b06d1c84a8be5164ffa994eea5997'} ```{.r .cell-code} #Linear Regression on Chatbot in interaction with mobile users: lm_chatbot_mobusr <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot* mobile_device, data=abtest_online) summary(lm_chatbot_mobusr) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot * mobile_device, data = abtest_online) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -16.98 -14.54 -9.95 14.13 65.24 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 16.9797 1.0152 16.725 <2e-16 *** #> chatbotTRUE -7.0301 1.4284 -4.922 1e-06 *** #> mobile_deviceTRUE -0.8727 1.7987 -0.485 0.628 #> chatbotTRUE:mobile_deviceTRUE -0.1526 2.5369 -0.060 0.952 #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 18.66 on 996 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.03534, Adjusted R-squared: 0.03244 #> F-statistic: 12.16 on 3 and 996 DF, p-value: 8.034e-08 ``` ::: ::: Negative estimate value indicates negative relation. 4. Logistic regression of purchase on chatbot: ::: {.cell hash='06_rct_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_79de04e04b46fb637a454b9c357edbb3'} ```{.r .cell-code} logistic_regression <- glm(purchase ~ chatbot, family=binomial(link='logit'), abtest_online) summary(logistic_regression) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> glm(formula = purchase ~ chatbot, family = binomial(link = "logit"), #> data = abtest_online) #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|) #> (Intercept) -0.01613 0.08981 -0.180 0.857 #> chatbotTRUE -0.98939 0.13484 -7.337 2.18e-13 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> (Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1) #> #> Null deviance: 1329.1 on 999 degrees of freedom #> Residual deviance: 1273.3 on 998 degrees of freedom #> AIC: 1277.3 #> #> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4 ``` ::: ::: The estimate value for ChatbotTrue is negative which means that having a chatbot decreases the chances of purchasing from a user and the p-value is less than 0.5 meaning this has a statistically significant effect. $\beta = -0.98939$ then $e^\beta = e^{-0.98939} = 0.372$ and this means having a chatbot is associated with a $62.8\% (1-0.372=0.628)$ reduction in the purchase possibility.
